Package paoo.game.tile

Class TileManager

java.lang.Object
paoo.game.tile.TileManager
public class TileManager extends Object
TileManager class implementing the Flyweight pattern for efficient tile management. This class handles loading, caching, and rendering of game tiles across multiple maps and layers. It manages tile images, collision data, and map layouts for a 2D tile-based game.

The class supports multiple maps (up to MAX_MAP) with 2 layers each, allowing for background and foreground tile rendering with proper layering.

  • Constructor Details

    • TileManager

      public TileManager(GamePanel gamePanel)
      Constructs a new TileManager with the specified GamePanel. Initializes tile array, map data structure, loads tile images, and loads all maps.
      Parameters:
      gamePanel - The main game panel containing game configuration and state

  • Method Details

    • getMapTileNumber

      public int[][][][] getMapTileNumber()
      Returns the complete map tile number array. This 4D array contains tile IDs for all maps, layers, columns, and rows.
      Returns:
      4D integer array with structure [map][layer][column][row]

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(int i)
      Retrieves a specific tile by its index.
      Parameters:
      i - The index of the tile to retrieve
      Returns:
      The Tile object at the specified index, or null if index is invalid

    • getTileImage

      public void getTileImage()
      Loads and sets up all tile images used in the game. This method calls setup() for each tile with its specific image path and collision properties. Tiles are organized by map layers: base tiles, second layer tiles, and third layer tiles.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D graphics2D)
      Renders all visible tiles to the screen using camera-based rendering. This method implements efficient viewport culling by only drawing tiles that are visible on screen based on the player's position.

      Renders tiles in layer order (0 then 1) to ensure proper visual layering. Uses the player's world position to calculate screen positions for each tile.

      Parameters:
      graphics2D - The Graphics2D context used for rendering

    • setup

      public void setup(int index, String imagePath, boolean collision)
      Sets up a tile with its image and collision properties. Uses image caching to avoid loading the same image multiple times. If the image fails to load, an error message is printed but execution continues.
      Parameters:
      index - The tile index in the tiles array
      imagePath - The path to the tile image (without file extension)
      collision - Whether this tile should have collision detection enabled

    • loadMap

      public void loadMap(String[] filePaths, int map)
      Loads map data from text files into the mapTileNumber array. Each map consists of 2 layers loaded from separate files.

      The method performs validation to ensure: - Files exist and are readable - All rows have consistent column counts - File contains expected number of rows - Tile numbers are within valid bounds

      Parameters:
      filePaths - Array of file paths for each layer (should contain 2 paths)
      map - The map index to load data into
